item.title: Artificial Intelligence.
item.description: This course is co-taught with Maria Andreina Francisco Rodriguez who is the main teacher. The course covers various aspects of AI that are not concerned with machine learning including heuristic search, planning and scheduling, statistical learning, Bayesian networks, AI in computer games.

item.title: Introduction to Machine Learning
item.description: Useful links: Slides and Assigments Official Syllabus This is a first course in machine learning. The course covers basic supervised and unsupervised methods (for example, regression, classification, decision trees, clustering), use of established tools for machine learning, application of the methods to real data, and practical aspects such as dimensionality reduction and cross validation. The course also introduces ethical aspects of bias in machine learning.
